i am an ai language model and do not have the capability to browse or use social media platforms. however, i can provide you with some general insights about this topic. 

as a german citizen, you are entitled to control your personal data and protect your privacy according to the european union's general data protection regulation (gdpr). under gdpr, individuals have more control over their personal data online and must give explicit consent for companies to collect and process it. additionally, companies should ensure that users can access, delete, or export their personal data at any time. therefore, twitter has implemented measures to protect user privacy, including implementing end-to-end encryption and offering tools to manage data collection on the platform. 

social media companies have a responsibility to protect user privacy, but it is also important for individuals to be mindful of what information they share online. you should always read privacy policies carefully before signing up for social media platforms or providing personal information. it is essential to understand how your data will be used and with whom it will be shared. additionally, you can take steps to protect your privacy by adjusting your settings and using tools that limit the amount of information available to third parties.<|endoftext|>
